#Text=Tom Jefferson ( epidemiologist )
#Text=Tom Jefferson is a British epidemiologist , based in Rome , Italy , [ 1 ] who works for the Cochrane Collaboration .
#Text=Jefferson is an author and editor of the Cochrane Collaboration 's acute respiratory infections group , as well as part of four other Cochrane groups . [ 2 ]
#Text=He is also an advisor to the Italian National Agency for Regional Health Services . [ 2 ]
#Text=In 1999 Jefferson was one of the founding members of the Brighton Collaboration along with Harald Heijbel , Ulrich Heininger , and Elisabeth Loupi . [ 3 ]
#Text=He has worked on Cochrane reviews examining the effectiveness of the anti-viral oseltamivir and the influenza vaccine . [ 4 ]
#Text=Notable work
#Text=In 2009
#Text=Jefferson was hired by the governments of Britain and Australia to update a systematic review of oseltamivir . [ 4 ]
#Text=Initially he had a great deal of trouble getting results of the original trials . [ 4 ]
#Text=Previous researchers had published trials without seeing the underlying data and it appeared that some of the published papers used ghost writers . [ 4 ]
#Text=As the company , Roche , that did the trials refused to provide data for independent analysis , their conclusions in 2009 were that benefits could not be shown . [ 4 ]
#Text=In 2011 Jefferson 's team was provided 22,000 pages of data from the European Medicines Agency and Roche eventually provided 3,000 pages of data . [ 4 ]
#Text=In 2012 , Jefferson was the lead author of another Cochrane review of this data which concluded that oseltamivir did not reduce the number of hospitalizations caused by influenza .
#Text=Jefferson said that this review also found no evidence that oseltamivir stopped complications from the disease . [ 5 ]

#Text=His views about the effectiveness of influenza vaccines and his outspokenness about them are also controversial ; at a 2007 meeting on pandemic preparedness he was shunned by other vaccine researchers and ate alone . [ 1 ]
#Text=Reviews led by Jefferson have concluded that there is insufficient evidence to show that influenza vaccines reduce mortality or infection rates . [ 6 ]

#Text=He has said that the studies claiming large reductions in mortality rates as a result of the influenza vaccine are " rubbish " , [ 1 ] and that " influenza vaccines are about marketing and not science " . [ 7 ]

column1: #Text=He has called repeatedly for placebo-controlled randomized clinical trials to prove the efficacy of flu vaccines , a position that most in the field hold as unethical . [ 1 ]
#Text=His views on flu vaccines are opposed by the medical establishment . [ 1 ]
